alert.note: Alert for Finney; Gray; Lane; Scott (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Finney, Scott, Lane and northwestern Gray Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Scott State Lake to 7 miles southeast of Shallow Water to near Deerfield. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Holcomb around 820 PM CDT. Garden City around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Plymell and Shields. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern and west central Kansas.
